content:
The Avner Shalev (Langsam) Family


Date: Thu, 29 Jun 2000 18:02:00 -0400 
From: Dov Rubin <DovRubin@compuserve.com> 
Subject: Re: Miller Family Ukraine & Langsams 
To: "moishe@langsam.com" <moishe@langsam.com> 


Dear Moishe,


I came across Suzan Wynne through another branch of family. Regarding other
Langsams in Israel, interestingly enough the head of Yad Vashem, Avner
Shalev, is really a Langsam. You will note that Shalev is the Hebraicized
translation of the name Langsam. I don't think, however, that he is into
the family tree thing.


Best regards,


Dov Rubin

______________________________________________________
From: Irena.steinfeldt@yadvashem.org.il
To: moishe@langsam.com
Date: Sun, 3 Feb 2002 11:34:29 +0200 

Good morning,
As promised, I talked to Avner Shalev about your web site. He is very
interested in your work, but says that due to his heavy workload at Yad
Vashem, he neglected dealing with his own family history. He will do his
best to find some time to answer you in detail. Meanwhile he wishes you all
the best and congratulates you on the work you have done so far. 
Best regards, 
Irena Steinfeldt
Executive Assistant to the Chairman of the Yad Vashem Directorate
tel: 972-2-6443636
fax: 972-2-6443452
email: irena.steinfeldt@yadvashem.org.il
www.yadvashem.org
______________________________________________________

Date: Thu, 04 Dec 2003 20:11:52 -0500 
To: Alexander.Avraham@yadvashem.org.il 
From: "moishe@langsam.com"  
Cc: solly.kaplinski@yadveshem.org.il, 

Dear Director, 

Thank you for your warm words and kind support. Perhaps you can
assist me in a somewhat selfish request. Dr. Avner Shalav is a
LANGSAM descendant, that was his family name. I have contacted 
him and his secretary (Irena Steinfeldt) countless times, but can
not seem to get any information. Does Dr. Shalav have any siblings
or relatives I can speak to instead? I do not need to find this out
from him. Like Yad >Vashem, I have the desire to perpetuate my
family, especially those that perished in the Holocaust. I can not
understand why someone in his position would not share a similar
attitude. As someone devoted to commemorating our heritage, perhaps
you can prevail upon him to answer three short questions: 
  * father's name 
  * his grandfather's name 
  * what city his grandfather was from  

Thanks again, 
Moishe Miller 

______________________________________________________

At 05:59 PM 1/8/04 +0200, solly.kaplinski@yadvashem.org.il wrote:

Hi Moshe, 

At last! Sorry for the delay. 

I have the info re Avner Shalev: 

Father: Dov Langsam - born 1904 

Grandfather: Zalman Langsam - wife: Faiga 

Grandfather born in Kanczuga and moved to Przeworsk. 

I hope this helps. 

Kol tuv! 

Solly Kaplinski

Subject:	  Re: My Mother maiden name wasYafa (schaindle)Langsam
From:	Zipi Schagrin 	
Date:	Thu, Aug 17, 2017 2:33 pm
To:	moishe@langsam.com

Hi,

Avner Shalev (Langsam) and me are second cousins.

My mother Yafa (scheindle/Sala) was a first cousin to Avner father Dov (Beiresh)Langsam.

My grandfather is Yakov(Yenkekle) Langsam. He was Zalman Langsam brother.

His first wife Zipora(Feige)she was my grandmother.I think she was born in Lancut . 
her family name was Landau. She died when my mother was 2 years old..

My mother, Yafa, was born in 1907 in Pprzeworsk Poland.

Yakov Langsam was married again to Sima Felner. They lived in Dembow Poland.

When my mother ,Yafa, was 12 , she was sent to live in Germany. 

In the end of 1933 she left Germany and came to Israel in January 1934.

I am sorry not to know much about my family. our parents did not talk too much about it.

Hope to here from you.

Zipi
